column4: can somebody just kick this guy toto23 out? he's bugging me via private messages with spam

i think only a mod can
did you check the md5 of your iso?

it should be good from a torrent
try adding    -t iso9660   to the mount command
wrong fstype is the error now
I got an md5sum starting with 183 and ending with 33c1. and it isnt listed on that page you directed me to.
bad download then, in your torrent client recheck, it should download the bad parts
I used Transmission. Using the verify local data option to check the data now.
I verified the torrent data and checked the md5sum again. Its still the same. (I had downloaded the torrent from the releases.ubuntu.com site)
if the md5 doesnt match its bad, i think the torrent isos should be the same as the others
